paragraphText: This demo just shows the scrolling text with an empty chart for now.
Right click on this text and see that each div element with class='narration' gets classed with .graph-scroll-active when the spacer ABOVE hits the top of the page.
The spacer heights can be controlled in narration_example.csv

Also notice the 'trigger' property on the div with class=narration.  The 'trigger' is a string that you can use to respond to actions received by ScrollyTeller.onActivateNarration() and ScrollyTeller.onScroll()
As we leave this section, we'll use onScroll( progress ) to fade things in and out.
The graph will fade out during the next narration as we trigger "unhide" on the DOM Element with id=narration_4.

hRefText: Here's a link to the scrolly-teller repo
